condition.name: Common Cold
condition.overview: A self-limited viral infection of the upper respiratory tract with runny nose, sore throat, sneezing and cough.
condition.red_flags: High fever, difficulty breathing, chest pain, symptoms >14 days, or sudden worsening — seek medical care.

plant.description: Traditionally used to support immune function and reduce duration of upper respiratory infections.

phytochemicals.name: Alkamides
phytochemicals.known_actions: Immune-modulating; interacts with CB2 and cytokine pathways.
phytochemicals.notes: Profile varies by plant part and species.

preparations.ingredients: Fresh or dried root/above-ground parts; alcohol
preparations.duration: Short-term during acute illness; avoid long continuous use without supervision.
preparations.notes: Commercial tinctures vary in concentration; follow label guidance.

preparations.ingredients: 1–2 tsp dried herb per 250 mL boiling water

plant.harvesting: Above-ground parts at flowering; roots in fall. Dry rapidly to prevent mold.
plant.sustainability: Prefer cultivated sources; avoid wild overharvesting.
plant.contraindications: Use cautiously in autoimmune disease; consult clinician if immunosuppressed.
plant.pregnancy_lactation_warning: Limited data; consult clinician before use.

condition.name: Insomnia
condition.overview: Difficulty initiating or maintaining sleep that impacts daytime functioning.
condition.red_flags: Sudden onset with severe daytime impairment, medication interactions, or underlying psychiatric/medical conditions — seek medical evaluation.

plant.description: Root traditionally used for sleep aid and mild anxiety relief.

phytochemicals.name: Valerenic acids
phytochemicals.known_actions: Proposed GABAergic modulation; CNS depressant effects.

preparations.duration: Short-term use; discuss with clinician for chronic insomnia.
preparations.notes: May interact with sedative medications and alcohol.

plant.harvesting: Roots in fall, when energy is highest; dry carefully.
plant.contraindications: Avoid with sedatives, benzodiazepines, heavy alcohol use; caution with liver disease.
plant.pregnancy_lactation_warning: Not recommended during pregnancy or breastfeeding without medical supervision.

condition.name: Mild Anxiety
condition.overview: Excessive worry or nervousness affecting daily activities; mild forms may be managed adjunctively with lifestyle and botanical approaches.
condition.red_flags: Severe anxiety, panic attacks, suicidal ideation or functional impairment — seek professional help.

plant.description: Root traditionally used in Pacific islands for anxiety and relaxation.

phytochemicals.name: Kavalactones
phytochemicals.notes: Known hepatotoxicity risk in some preparations; quality & solvent matter.

preparations.dosage: Traditional dosing varies; modern extracts differ—follow clinical guidance
preparations.duration: Short-term use; avoid chronic high-dose use.
preparations.notes: Potential for liver risk; contraindicated with alcohol and some medications.

plant.harvesting: Roots harvested from mature plants; sustainable cultivation recommended.
plant.sustainability: Cultivated sources help preserve wild populations.
plant.contraindications: Avoid with liver disease, alcohol, CNS depressants; review drug interactions.
